title: Supreme Court Weighs Emotional-Distress Damages for Discrimination
sub_head: A disabled woman’s lawsuit attracts interest from civil-rights organizations and business groups
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court on Tuesday wrestled with whether people with disabilities can seek monetary damages for emotional distress when they allegedly face discrimination in obtaining medical treatment.
At issue was the case of a deaf and visually impaired woman in Texas who needed physical therapy for back pain. When she contacted a Dallas-Fort Worth area clinic in 2016 and 2017, she requested a sign-language interpreter, saying she couldn’t effectively communicate without one. The clinic declined, instead offering that they could communicate with notes, gestures and lip reading.
